intro: Dimorphostemon pinnatus, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink or red. The plant has palmately lobed leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Dimorphostemon pinnatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
